qas.question: What was the population of Kathmandu in 1991?
About how many people are likely to live in Kathmandu in 2021?
How dense was the population of Kathmandu in 1991?
How many acres of land did the KMC control in 2001?

context: Over the years the city has been home to people of various ethnicities, resulting in a range of different traditions and cultural practices. In one decade, the population increased from <a0_0>427,045<a0_0/> in 1991 to 671,805 in 2001. The population was projected to reach 915,071 in 2011 and <a1_0>1,319,597<a1_0/> by 2021. To keep up this population growth, the KMC-controlled area of 5,076.6 hectares (12,545 acres) has expanded to 8,214 hectares (<a3_0>20,300<a3_0/> acres) in 2001. With this new area, the population density which was <a2_0>85<a2_0/> in 1991 is still 85 in 2001; it is likely to jump to 111 in 2011 and 161 in 2021.
